intro: Tarenna kotoensis, commonly known as the Kotoensis Tarenna, is a flowering plant species native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Tarenna kotoensis is often found in humid, shaded forest environments. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
